test_cases.Title: DocumentiCollegati_XXX_DocumentManagement_TEST_Desktop_Verification of attached documents

Steps.Step Description: Open the document section of the application.
Steps.Expected Result: The document section is displayed successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Locate the table listing attached documents.
Steps.Expected Result: The table is visible with correct headings: 'N.', 'Titolo', 'Versione', 'Data'.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the document 'RU Sportsbook Platform - Anagrafica e Gestione Eventi Brand Spagna' is present.
Steps.Expected Result: The document title 'RU Sportsbook Platform - Anagrafica e Gestione Eventi Brand Spagna' is listed correctly in the table.

Steps.Step Description: Check the version and date fields for the document.
Steps.Expected Result: The version is '3.0' and the date field is either filled or marked as N/A if not applicable.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged in and has access to the document management section.
test_cases.Expected Result: The attached document is correctly displayed with accurate version and date information.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Tests the presence and details of a specific document; does not cover editing or removing documents.

test_cases.Title: DocumentiCollegati_XXX_DocumentManagement_TEST_Desktop_Verification of document absence

Steps.Step Description: Open the document section of the application.
Steps.Expected Result: The document section is displayed successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Inspect the table for listed attached documents.
Steps.Expected Result: The table is visible with correct headings: 'N.', 'Titolo', 'Versione', 'Data'.

Steps.Step Description: Check if a non-existing document title is displayed, e.g., 'Nonexistent Document'.
Steps.Expected Result: The document table does not contain the title 'Nonexistent Document' and possibly a message stating no records found.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged in and has access to the document management section.
test_cases.Expected Result: No presence of the indicated non-existing document, with appropriate feedback for the user.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Tests the absence of a document; does not cover document addition functionality.

test_cases.Title: definition_abbreviation_001_Requirement_Definitions_TEST_Desktop_Verify the definitions and abbreviations table

Steps.Step Description: Open the document containing the definitions and abbreviations.
Steps.Expected Result: The document is displayed correctly without any formatting issues.

Steps.Step Description: Locate the table containing definitions and abbreviations.
Steps.Expected Result: The table is found and visible on the document.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that all acronyms listed in the table are defined.
Steps.Expected Result: All acronyms have corresponding definitions present in the document.

Steps.Step Description: Check the clarity of each definition for technical jargon.
Steps.Expected Result: Each definition is clear and easily understandable.

Steps.Step Description: Identify if the definitions include any missing items based on requirements.
Steps.Expected Result: All relevant and required definitions are present without omissions.

test_cases.Preconditions: User must have access to the latest version of the requirements document.
test_cases.Expected Result: All definitions and abbreviations are correctly defined and clear.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validation covers only the clarity and presence of definitions; usage in context not evaluated.

test_cases.Title: definition_abbreviation_002_Requirement_Definitions_TEST_Desktop_Verify the accuracy of abbreviation meanings

Steps.Step Description: Open the document containing the definitions and abbreviations.
Steps.Expected Result: The document is displayed correctly without any formatting issues.

Steps.Step Description: Locate the abbreviations within the definitions and abbreviations table.
Steps.Expected Result: The abbreviations section is found and visible on the document.

Steps.Step Description: Cross-reference each abbreviation with the glossary of terms from relevant documentation.
Steps.Expected Result: Each abbreviation matches the definition provided in the glossary.

Steps.Step Description: Identify any inaccuracies in the definitions provided for each abbreviation.
Steps.Expected Result: No inaccuracies are found; all definitions are accurate.

test_cases.Preconditions: User must have access to both this document and the glossary terms.
test_cases.Expected Result: All abbreviations are verified and accurately defined.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: This test focuses on abbreviation accuracy and does not encompass visual representation.

test_cases.Title: modifica_a_sport_singolo_XXX_PERCORSO_BASE_ModdificaSport_TEST_Web_Confirming the change of visibility for a specific sport

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Sports section of the Spain Brand as per the defined base case.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully directed to the Sports section of the Spain Brand.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the presence and correct loading of the Sports DGOJ section.
Steps.Expected Result: The Sports DGOJ section is displayed correctly.

Steps.Step Description: Identify the specific Sport DGOJ for which the visibility field is to be modified.
Steps.Expected Result: The intended Sport DGOJ is easily identifiable in the list.

Steps.Step Description: Select the dropdown menu corresponding to the 'Visible' column for the identified Sport DGOJ.
Steps.Expected Result: The dropdown menu is successfully opened for editing.

Steps.Step Description: Change the visibility setting from 'Yes' to 'No'.
Steps.Expected Result: The selection successfully updates to 'No' in the dropdown.

Steps.Step Description: A confirmation popup should appear after changing the visibility setting.
Steps.Expected Result: The confirmation popup is displayed to the user.

Steps.Step Description: Confirm the operation by selecting the 'Confirm' button in the popup.
Steps.Expected Result: The operation is confirmed and proceeds without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that a success toast appears indicating the changes were successfully made.
Steps.Expected Result: A toast message stating 'Changes made successfully' is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the affected Sport DGOJ row is greyed out in the Sports section of the Spain Brand.
Steps.Expected Result: The specific Sport DGOJ row is visually greyed out.

Steps.Step Description: Check that associations in the Prototypes section related to the modified Sport are removed.
Steps.Expected Result: The associations with the Sport BM in the Prototypes section are successfully removed.

Steps.Step Description: Confirm that re-association of the Sport BM with the modified Sport DGOJ is disabled.
Steps.Expected Result: It is confirmed that re-association is not possible.

test_cases.Preconditions: User must be logged in to the system and have appropriate permissions to modify sports.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials with permissions to modify sports visibility
test_cases.Expected Result: The visibility of the selected Sport DGOJ is successfully changed to 'No' with expected UI updates.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso Base – modifica a sport singolo
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Test focuses on modifying visibility only; other functionalities related to sports management are not covered.

test_cases.Title: edit_sport_visibility_XXX_MODIFICHE_VISIBILITA_SPORT_TEST_Desktop_Change field from 'No' to 'Yes'

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the application with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User successfully logs in and is redirected to the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Sports section.
Steps.Expected Result: The Sports section is displayed with the list of sports.

Steps.Step Description: Locate the sport entry currently set to 'No' visibility.
Steps.Expected Result: The sport entry is correctly displayed with 'No' under the visibility column.

Steps.Step Description: Edit the visibility field from 'No' to 'Yes' for the selected sport.
Steps.Expected Result: The field is successfully updated to 'Yes'.

Steps.Step Description: Proceed with steps 6 and 7 of the base use case for modifying a sport.
Steps.Expected Result: The application executes steps 6 and 7 without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Check the front-end for the visibility change effect.
Steps.Expected Result: The sport entry is displayed in black in the Sports section of Brand Spain.

Steps.Step Description: Go to the Prototypes section to verify associations.
Steps.Expected Result: Any associations between Sport BM entity and Sport DGOJ entity are restored.

test_cases.Preconditions: User must have edit permissions for sports visibility.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials, selected sport entry
test_cases.Expected Result: Sport visibility is updated successfully and reflects in front-end and Prototypes section.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – modifica a sport singolo: campo 'Visibile' sì
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Test only the visibility change; does not cover sports association logic.

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the application with valid credentials.

test_cases.Title: Error Handling Saving_Data_001_App_TEST_Desktop_Display Error Toast Message

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to save data in the application when a connectivity issue occurs.
Steps.Expected Result: The operation fails, and the client shows a toast message indicating an error.

Steps.Step Description: Observe if any data changes remain visible after the error.
Steps.Expected Result: No changes should be saved; the data should remain in its previous state.

Steps.Step Description: Confirm that the case terminates correctly after displaying the error message.
Steps.Expected Result: The application cleanly handles the termination of the case without any system errors.

test_cases.Preconditions: The application is running, user is authenticated, and the system is experiencing network issues.
test_cases.Dataset: No specific dataset is required; test can be performed with any saved data.
test_cases.Expected Result: User sees an appropriate error message, and no data changes are saved.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Errore durante il salvataggio
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers error handling for save operation; does not test recovery from error.

test_cases.Title: Validation of Error Message_Display_002_App_TEST_Desktop_Toast Error Feedback

Steps.Step Description: Trigger an error while saving data intentionally (e.g., disconnect network).
Steps.Expected Result: The application displays a toast message with an appropriate error description.

Steps.Step Description: Check the content of the toast message.
Steps.Expected Result: The toast message accurately reflects the error encountered (e.g., 'Failed to save data due to network issues.').

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged into the application and attempts to save data.
test_cases.Dataset: Current session's data to be saved.
test_cases.Expected Result: Correct error message is shown in the toast notification.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Errore durante il salvataggio
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates the accuracy of error messages but does not cover all possible error scenarios.

test_cases.Title: search_event_after_previous_search_XXX_USECASE_Search_Event_TEST_Desktop_verifying the subsequent search for events after a previous search

Steps.Expected Result: The events management page is displayed successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Ensure no events are selected.
Steps.Expected Result: No events are highlighted for selection.

Steps.Step Description: Click on the kebab menu of the 'Internazionale' field.
Steps.Expected Result: The system should display a message indicating no selections have been made.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged in and on the events management page.
test_cases.Expected Result: No modification is applied, and a relevant message is displayed.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Modifica campo 'Internazionale' tramite selezione multipla
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Only tests the behavior when no items are selected for modification.

test_cases.Title: alternative_path_not_found_001_Manifestation_response_TEST_Web_SearchError

Steps.Step Description: Trigger a search action that returns no results.
Steps.Expected Result: The client displays a message indicating no results were found.

Steps.Step Description: Inspect the displayed message.
Steps.Expected Result: The message is clear and indicates that no manifestation was found.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to perform a new search.
Steps.Expected Result: The system returns to the initial search step with 'Internazionale' set to 'No'.

Steps.Step Description: Select the option to abandon the operation.
Steps.Expected Result: The use case terminates gracefully without errors.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is on the search page and has attempted a search.
test_cases.Expected Result: The search handling functionality behaves as specified, displaying appropriate messages.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Only covers the case when no results are found; does not test other search functionalities.

test_cases.Title: alternative_path_not_found_002_Manifestation_retry_TEST_Web_NoResult

Steps.Step Description: Perform a search that leads to no results.
Steps.Expected Result: The message indicating that no results were found is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate back to the search input to perform a new search.
Steps.Expected Result: The system resets to the initial search conditions with 'Internazionale' set to 'No'.

Steps.Step Description: Enter new search criteria and submit.
Steps.Expected Result: The system processes the new search request based on the updated criteria.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has initiated a search that resulted in 'no results'.
test_cases.Dataset: New search parameters after no results
test_cases.Expected Result: The system handles the new search query correctly and displays results if available.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: This test checks the retry functionality specifically after receiving no results.

test_cases.Title: Cancellation of Assignment_001_Requirement_Operation_Cancellation_TEST_Desktop_User interrupts assignment operation

Steps.Step Description: Open the assignment operation popup for the field 'Internazionale'.
Steps.Expected Result: The popup for assigning the 'Internazionale' field is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Press the 'Cancel' button or the 'x' button to close the popup.
Steps.Expected Result: The assignment operation is interrupted, and the popup closes.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the application did not make any changes to the field 'Internazionale'.
Steps.Expected Result: No changes to the field 'Internazionale' are observed.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is on the assignment operation popup for the field 'Internazionale'.
test_cases.Expected Result: Assignment operation is successfully interrupted with no changes made.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Interruzione operazione di assegnazione del campo 'Internazionale'
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers cancellation operation; does not validate assignment success.

test_cases.Title: error_handling_save_001_Functionality_Test_Desktop_Verifying error handling when saving fails

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to save a document while a simulated saving error occurs.
Steps.Expected Result: The system displays an error message indicating that the saving operation was unsuccessful.

Steps.Step Description: Check if any modifications were applied to the document.
Steps.Expected Result: No modifications are applied, and the document remains unchanged.

Steps.Step Description: Review the error message details for massive operation failure cases.
Steps.Expected Result: The system displays a message about the specific elements that were successfully modified.

Steps.Step Description: Select the option to attempt the saving operation again.
Steps.Expected Result: The user is redirected to the document editing interface with the 'Internazionale' field set to 'No.'

Steps.Step Description: Cancel the operation.
Steps.Expected Result: The case ends without any changes saved, and the user is returned to the main menu.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged in and has an editable document open.
test_cases.Dataset: Document in edit mode with an error-triggering mechanism active
test_cases.Expected Result: Error is handled correctly; document modifications are either not saved or partially saved as appropriate.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers error messaging and handling but does not validate recovery scenarios beyond retrying.

test_cases.Title: massive_operation_error_handling_002_Functionality_Test_Mobile_Verifying error messaging for bulk operation failures

Steps.Step Description: Initiate a massive operation save on multiple documents.
Steps.Expected Result: The system processes the request, showing a loading indicator.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate a saving error within the bulk operation.
Steps.Expected Result: An error message appears detailing which documents failed to save and which were saved successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to correct the documents that failed and resubmit the massive operation.
Steps.Expected Result: The system allows the user to modify and reattempt saving for only the problematic documents.

Steps.Step Description: Cancel the operation without making changes.
Steps.Expected Result: User returns to the bulk document management screen without unsaved changes.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged in and has multiple documents prepared for bulk updates.
test_cases.Dataset: Set of documents for bulk operation with error prevention systems engaged
test_cases.Expected Result: Massive operations are handled properly with detailed error reporting for user actions.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Focus on error messaging; does not test granular success scenarios within bulk saving.

test_cases.Title: DateTimeFilter_SetTodayShortcut_Negative_001_Functionality_APP_TEST_Desktop_Inappropriate usage of the shortcut

Steps.Expected Result: The date and time filtering interface is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Use the shortcut 'Set Today' while a prior date range is selected.
Steps.Expected Result: The application prompts an error or warning message regarding the change.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the error message displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: An appropriate error message regarding data conflict or range limitation is shown.

Steps.Step Description: Close the error message and verify that the filter values remain unchanged.
Steps.Expected Result: The original 'Start Date' and 'End Date' values remain the same.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged into the application and has a prior date range set in the filter.
test_cases.Expected Result: Inappropriate usage results in error and maintains the original filter values.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Utilizzo filtro 'Data/ora' tramite shortcut 'Imposta oggi'
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Tests error handling for conflicting date ranges, not the main functionality.

test_cases.Title: no_results_search_001_usecase_search_event_TEST_web_verifying no results returned

Steps.Step Description: Perform a search in the application with criteria that returns no results.
Steps.Expected Result: The application displays an empty event grid without any items.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the option to perform a new search is present.
Steps.Expected Result: The user is able to see and access the option to perform a new search.

Steps.Step Description: Choose to perform a new search.
Steps.Expected Result: The application navigates to the search interface allowing for a new search input.

Steps.Step Description: Choose to abandon the operation.
Steps.Expected Result: The application terminates the use case and redirects the user to the previous screen or main menu.

test_cases.Preconditions: The user is logged into the application and is on the search page.
test_cases.Dataset: Search criteria that guarantees no results
test_cases.Expected Result: The event grid is empty, new search option is accessible, and the user can navigate away or perform a new search.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Nessun risultato dalla ricerca
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers scenarios for when no results are found but does not cover the content of the new search.

test_cases.Title: filter_date_time_001_PROTOTYPES_TEST_Desktop_User selects date/time filter after a search

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Prototypes section after performing a search.
Steps.Expected Result: The Prototypes section is displayed with previous search results.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the 'Date/Time' filter is enabled.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Date/Time' filter is visible and selectable.

Steps.Step Description: Check that the 'Date/Time' filter is filled with previous values.
Steps.Expected Result: The filter displays previously input values.

Steps.Step Description: Click on the 'Remove all filters' button.
Steps.Expected Result: All filter values are cleared from the interface.

Steps.Step Description: Set a new value for the 'Date/Time' filter.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Date/Time' filter now reflects the newly set value.

Steps.Step Description: Return to step 4 to repeat filter removal process and set new values again.
Steps.Expected Result: User is able to repeat removing filters and setting new values without error.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has successfully performed a search in the Prototypes section.
test_cases.Dataset: Previous filter values and new values to be set
test_cases.Expected Result: Filters are managed appropriately without errors, allowing for proper user interaction.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso base 2 – Imposta filtro 'Data/ora' dopo aver già eseguito una ricerca
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers selection and modification of date/time filters; does not test interaction with other filters.

test_cases.Title: Filtro_Data_ora_Disabilitato_001_Automatizzazione_TEST_Desktop_RimozioneFiltri

Steps.Step Description: Accedere all'applicazione e navigare alla sezione contenente il filtro 'Data/ora'.
Steps.Expected Result: Il filtro 'Data/ora' è visualizzato come disabilitato.

Steps.Step Description: Cliccare sul pulsante 'rimuovi tutti i filtri'.
Steps.Expected Result: Tutti i filtri attivi, compreso il filtro 'Data/ora', vengono rimossi.

Steps.Step Description: Verificare che il filtro 'Data/ora' sia disabilitato dopo la rimozione di tutti i filtri.
Steps.Expected Result: Il filtro 'Data/ora' rimane disabilitato.

Steps.Step Description: Rimuovere manualmente qualsiasi valore nel filtro 'descrizione (o id interno)'.
Steps.Expected Result: Il filtro 'descrizione (o id interno)' non mostra più alcun valore.

Steps.Step Description: Procedere con lo step 4 del Percorso base.
Steps.Expected Result: L'azione prevista per lo step 4 del Percorso base è completata con successo.

test_cases.Preconditions: L'utente è autenticato e si trova nella pagina corretta contenente i filtri.
test_cases.Expected Result: Il filtro 'Data/ora' rimane disabilitato e non può essere utilizzato.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo 2 – Il filtro 'Data/ora' risulta disabilitato
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Coprire solamente la disabilitazione del filtro 'Data/ora'; altri filtri non inclusi.

test_cases.Title: Filtro_Data_ora_Disabilitato_002_Automatizzazione_TEST_Desktop_VerificaComportamento

Steps.Step Description: Tentare di interagire con il filtro 'Data/ora' (cliccare o selezionare).

Steps.Step Description: Procedere a rimuovere tutti i valori nei filtri usando 'rimuovi tutti i filtri'.

test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Verifica che il filtro 'Data/ora' non sia interattivo quando disabilitato.
